title: Twosday Night Adventure
details: Year-round, bi-weekly bicycle adventure beginning at Irving Park near the picnic benches by the playground. Meet at 7PM, roll out at 7:30. Approximately a 10-15mi ride at a moderate pace. We usually make a mid-way stop and one supply stop before the mystery end location. This ride is not a loop. Music, costumes and decorations encouraged. Experienced ride leaders (that have attended TNA) are encouraged and welcome to lead; please reach out to get yourself on our calendar!
printdescr: Year-round, bi-weekly bicycle adventure beginning at Irving Park near the picnic benches by the playground.

title: Civil Unrest bicycle club monthly ride
address: Natio pkwy and sw. Salmon street
details: We are putting up Notes of Hope on some local bridges, taking over the streets, and laughing at the law. LGBTQIA safe space, all abilities welcome. Disability advocacy group where all club members have a disability, and ALL are welcome to ride
printdescr: Disability advocacy group putting up Notes of Hope on the portland area bridges each month. LGBTQ safe space, slow pace.

title: Foster Night Ride
details: Come meet your friends, family and neighbors and get some food by the fire, before the ride. Come prepared for anything, be kind to all travelers, pack out what you bring in, have the ride of your life. Guess ride leaders are encouraged, ask your ride leader. We are focused mainly on south east Portland but we ride everywhere.
timedetails: Meet up at 6:30pm ride out at 7:30pm
printdescr: Meet up at fopo food carts at 6:30 pm ride out at 7:30pm

title: Corvidae Bike Club Ride
address: N Albina Ave and Ainsworth St
details: We aim to promote bike safety and accessibility, and to inspire biking as a alternative to fossil fueled travel within Portland. Let's have some fun while were at it! Come join us for a 2nd Sunday Funday ride every month. We meet at the Rose Fountain at the center of the Peninsula Park Rose Garden at 2PM. We roll out at 2:30. This will be a social-paced mystery ride. We generally make a couple park or supply stops. Each ride is lead by a different CORVIDAE member, and therefore will be unique. NOT A LOOP. This is a safe environment for all. Please check our FB page to review the CORVIDAE Code of Conduct as well as detailed descriptions of each ride. Ca-CAWW!
printdescr: We aim to promote bike safety and accessibility, and to inspire biking as a alternative to fossil fueled travel!

geoLookup.formattedAddress: SW Salmon St & SW Naito Pkwy, Portland, OR 97204, USA

title: Three Speed Day Tour
details: It's time for a lovely day tour on three speed bicycles! Destination: Oregon City, where we can have a fine lunch, use America's favorite municipal elevator, tour the promenade, and see the Falls. Then we ride back to Portland. Lovely! This ride is open to all bikes that have a three speed internal geared hub. Hub and bike can be of any age and from any country. We also accept four and five speed internal geared hubs, but nothing larger. No derailleur equipped bicycles unless: a) it is on a Brompton or b) derailleur acts as chain tensioner. This out-and-back ride will be approximately 25 miles long. We'll have a BYO tea stop along the way (coffee OK too), you'll either need to bring a stove, or brew it in advance and carry it in a thermos. We'll have lunch at a pub in Oregon City. This is a LEISURELY ride. We will take our time, we will have breaks. Don't think we'll be done by 1 PM. Nope, this is not that type of ride! Expect to be out until early evening and you won't be disappointed or stressed.
locdetails: Starts in inner SE, near MAX. Registrants will get exact location emailed to them a week before the ride.
printdescr: Why do I need to put in a print description?
newsflash: Cancelled due to current world situation. I plan on doing a ride in October.

title: Easter egg hunt; optional social distance
address: Southeast ivon street and se 47th ave
details: First egg mound/clue at Ivon street park on the corner of southeast Ivon and 47th A clue based Easter hunt from spot to spot, mainly parks. This is designed to done by yourself or feel free to do with friends. There will be vegan Easter candy eggs as well. Egg mounds will be placed at each clue locations with the next location hint until you have reached the final park. Bonus for those who finish first, those who dress to impress the Easter spirit, and those who grab the “surprise eggs”. The end spot with be an optional end spot with beer and games and possibly food. If social distancing please feel free to live post your rides or take selfies to share your experience
timedetails: May start whenever you feel but eggs might be gone
printdescr: Egg huntA

geoLookup.formattedAddress: SE 47th Ave & SE Ivon St, Portland, OR 97206, USA

title: Tracklocross Nationals qualifier race
details: Tracklocross is coming ! This is 1 out of 3 races that's happening in April & May. Racers will race their track bikes on a cyclocross course for 40 minutes. There will be a male and WTFNB category. There is a 10 registration fee the money collected from the race is going to flying out BOTH winners of the tracklocross qualifier races to Atlanta to fight with the 12 other cities involved In this event to get the title of Tracklocross National Champion. Follow Pdxtracklocross
printdescr: Tracklocross Nationals qualifier races April 19, May 10 and May 26. Winners of the race will be flown to ATL.

title: Forest Fire Ride (12 ft bonfire)
details: Meet at Couch Park. I got wood stashed I cut in park that's deep it's dry to, feel free to bring more wood. We taking fire trail across Park till we are deep enough to stop on trail and light a fire. Tired of Thursday night ride circle jerk. Please message me before or me and my buddy's are not waiting, not showing. Last one we had was awesome. You'll see. It's way of radar. Everyone around that area goes to bed at 5pm up at 5am work by 8am. Whole Pearl district is on this schedule constantly.
printdescr: Come make a fire in the Forest not there River.
